title: Terms out for $255.5 million Elanor Commercial fund IPO
text:
Property fund manager Elanor is seeking to raise as much as $255.5 million for its Elanor Commercial Property Fund initial public offering.

Brokers Moelis, Shaw and Ord Minnett blasted terms to potential investors on Tuesday afternoon.

The deal was priced at $1.25 a security which implied a 7.2 per cent distribution yield for the 2020 financial year and 7.3 per cent based on 2021 forecasts, the term sheet said.

There were up to 204.4 million securities up for grabs, with the exact number dependent on how many existing unitholders opt to redeem securities as part of the float.

Street Talk. Peter Braig

It was also at a premium to the $1.19 a security net tangible asset value.
description: Property fund manager Elanor is seeking to raise as much as $255.5 million for its Elanor Commercial Property Fund initial public offering.
